The company announced today that their net loss tripled and employees can finally sell their RSUs next week.The one newly public tech company that seems to have weathered the storm is Roblox, which fell from its ATH of $83 to $61 on Monday, before recovering $70 as of today.But it's not just tech companies that IPOd in 2020-2021. 2019 IPOs Lyft, Uber, Pinterest, and Snap - which, except for Lyft, all reached their ATHs during COVID - saw significant gains during the pandemic, have also crashed since the end of April.LYFT tanked from $63 on Apr 28 to 46 today.
